questions.title: Question 1
questions.content: A junior analyst is trying to use the tcpdump -i eth1 command on an Ubuntu system, but it is not working. What could be the problem?

choices.name: A
choices.content: The tcpdump command requires root level privilege.

choices.name: B
choices.content: The tcpdump command requires the Ethernet adapter to be in non-promiscuous mode.

choices.name: C
choices.content: The tcpdump command -i option used to specify the interface is an invalid option.

choices.name: D
choices.content: The tcpdump command used is missing some of the required options (such as -n and -v).

questions.title: Question 2
questions.content: Which control plane protocol is used between Cisco SD-WAN routers and vSmart controllers?

choices.name: A
choices.content: TCP

choices.name: B
choices.content: OMP

choices.name: C
choices.content: UDP

choices.name: D
choices.content: BGP

questions.title: Question 3
questions.content: If an attacker uses phishing to obtain user credentials for an employee without administrator access and needs to install a rootkit backdoor that requires system level access, what might be the attacker's next course of action to gain the administrator privileges?

choices.name: A
choices.content: set a scheduled task to install the rootkit the following day under the current user account

choices.name: B
choices.content: try to brute force that user's password for an RDP connection to the user's workstation

choices.name: C
choices.content: change the IP address of the user's computer from DHCP-assigned to static.

choices.name: D
choices.content: attempt to extract local administrator credentials stored on the machine in running memory or the registry

questions.title: Question 4
questions.content: Why is a transparent firewall considered a "bump in the wire" or "stealth firewall"?

choices.name: A
choices.content: It is a bump on the wire because it filters packets at the OSI physical layer.

choices.name: B
choices.content: Using separate IP subnets for inside and outside interfaces, packets are inspected quietly.

choices.name: C
choices.content: A transparent firewall is considered a Layer 2 firewall and has no routing capabilities.

choices.name: D
choices.content: Transparent firewalls work in "stealth mode" by using network taps.

choices.name: E
choices.content: Because transparent firewalls can route between inside and outside interfaces, packets are "bumped" between them by using special firewall rule-sets.

questions.title: Question 5
questions.content: If a windows host is under DoS attack, what tool can be used to monitor the current CPU and memory usage?

choices.name: A
choices.content: resource monitor

choices.name: B
choices.content: device manager

choices.name: C
choices.content: msconfig

choices.name: D
choices.content: netstat
